intro: Microstephanus, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are characterized by their rhizomatous growth and upright, herbaceous stems. The leaves are typically alternate, with a distinctive sheathing base and a broad, lance-shaped blade. Flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, often with a greenish or reddish hue. These plants are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and are often found in moist, shaded environments.
